intro: Chrysophtalmum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These plants typically have showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. They are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Chrysophtalmum species are herbaceous perennials, growing to varying heights depending on the species. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to their ecological importance.
